title:
Deterministic approximate counting of colorings with fewer than
  $2\Delta$ colors via absence of zeros
authors: Ferenc Bencs, Khallil Berrekkal, Guus Regts
abstract:
Let $\Delta,q\geq 3$ be integers. We prove that there exists $\eta\geq 0.002$
such that if $q\geq (2-\eta)\Delta$, then there exists an open set
$\mathcal{U}\subset \mathbb{C}$ that contains the interval $[0,1]$ such that
for each $w\in \mathcal{U}$ and any graph $G=(V,E)$ of maximum degree at most
$\Delta$, the partition function of the anti-ferromagnetic $q$-state Potts
model evaluated at $w$ does not vanish. This provides a (modest) improvement on
a result of Liu, Sinclair, and Srivastava, and breaks the $q=2\Delta$-barrier
for this problem.
  As a direct consequence we obtain via Barvinok's interpolation method a
deterministic polynomial time algorithm to approximate the number of proper
$q$-colorings of graphs of maximum degree at most $\Delta$, provided $q\geq
(2-\eta)\Delta$.
subjects: Computing Research Repository/Data Structures and Algorithms
